alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 25 at 2:05PM MST until December 27 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 12 to 18 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Sierra Madre and Snowy Range to include Centennial and Albany. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Hikers and snow mobilers likely to become disoriented and lost with very poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
